SENT.plain: Three cases of anterior choroid artery are reported, representing 0.80% of all strokes admitted to our Service in the last 3 years
Their clinical features were manifold and only motor involvement was common to the 3 patients, although with varying intensity and topography
In one case there was pure motor hemiparesis
Only one patient had sensory impairment, whereas none had defects in the fields of vision
In the 3 patients, CT showed the characteristic hypodense image limited to the posterior limb of the internal capsule, whereas EEG was normal in the 3 patients
The clinical outcome was very satisfactory in one patient and fair in the other two, with persisting sequelae which did not prevent an autonomous lifestyle
